data.title: Colonial Christian School
data.text:
Staff Directory

Senior Administrative Staff

Pastor Bill Long

Senior Pastor

Pastor Bill Long has served at SDBC since 2004. He and his wife, Carol, have 4 grown sons, and 13 grandchildren (8 of whom attend, or have attended CCS). Pastor Long graduated from Manahath School of Theology in 1985 with a BA in Pastoral Ministries, did pulpit supply for area churches in Pennsylvania, and worked as a Christian counselor at the Altoona Christian Counseling Center. A verse that is precious to him is 2 Chronicles 16:9: For the eyes of the Lord run to and fro throughout the whole earth to show Himself strong on behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward Him.

Email:long.pastorbill@colonialchristianschool.org

Terri Morrissey

Administrator

Mrs. Morrissey has served at CCS since 2004. She has attended South Dade Baptist Church since 1998. She and her husband, John, have two children: John Jr. and Sarah, both CCS graduates and valedictorians. Mrs. Morrissey holds a BS from the University of Miami, MS and Ed.S from Barry University, and Ed.S from Florida International University. She is certified with the State of Florida as a K-12 teacher and reading specialist, and with FACCS as an administrator. A verse that is precious to her is Matthew 5:16: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father in heaven.

Email:patriots@colonialchristianschool.org

Administrative Staff

Laura Pecina

Dean of Students

Mrs. Pecina has served at CCS since 2015. She has attended Christ Fellowship Redland and Summit Church since 2008. She and her husband, Pastor Alex Pecina, have three children, Isabella, Mikaela, and Gabriella. Mrs. Pecina holds an AA from Miami Dade College and a BA in Interdisciplinary Studies from Florida International University. She is certified with FACCS as a Social Science Teacher for All Levels. A verse that is precious to her is Colossians 3:17: And whatever you do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through Him.

Email:pecina.l@colonialchristianschool.org

Early Elementary Staff

Dominique Johnson – Alumni

PreK3 Teacher

Ms. Johnson joined CCS in 2023 and is a proud CCS alumni. She attends Pasos De Fe Church. She has a beloved son, Ellis. She has 13 years’ experience in Early childhood education. She holds a FCCPC for Pre-K and has gained experience on getting the national accreditation from NAEYC (National Association for Young Children). A verse that is precious to her is Romans 8:38-39: For I am sure that neither death nor life, nor angels nor rulers, nor things present nor things to come, nor powers, nor height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God in Christ Jesus our Lord.

Email:Johnson.d@colonialchristianschool.org

Crystal Nelson

PreK4 Teacher/ Extended Care

Mrs Nelson has served at CCS since 2018. She has attended South Dade Baptist Church since 2020. She and her husband, Blaine, have two beautiful children, Jonathon and Allyssa. Mrs. Nelson has 21 years experience in Early Childhood Education. She holds a FCCPC for Pre-K with a certification in VPK, as well an Advanced Directors Credential. In the past, she has been the Director/Principal of a NAEYC nationally Accredited Preschool, with rolls in Child Care Management such as staff development, Curriculum Specialist and is Conscious Discipline certified for behavior management. She is certified with FACCS as an Early Education Teacher. A verse that is precious to her is “Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God.”

‭‭Matthew‬ ‭5:8‬ ‭

Email:nelson.c@colonialchristianschool.org

Keri Lobdell

K5 Teacher

Mrs. Lobdell has served at CCS since 2019. She attends First Baptist of Key Largo. She and her husband, Dean, have one son, Cole, who lives in Orlando. Mrs. Lobdell holds a BS from Hyles Anderson College. She is certified with FACCS as an Elementary Teacher. A verse that is precious to her is Proverbs 3:27: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.

Email:lobdell.k@colonialchristianschool.org

Cinthia Martin

K5 Teacher

Mrs. Martin joined CCS in 2023. She has attended Restoration church since 2021. She has a beloved son, Carlos. Ms. Pena has been in the education realm for almost a decade. She has a bachelors in English Literature from Florida International University. A verse that is precious to her is Jeremiah 29:11: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the Lord, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.

Email:pena.c@colonialchristianschool.org

Elementary Staff

Katia Quintana

1st Grade Teacher

Barbara Quinones

4th Grade Teacher

Mrs. Quiñones has served at CCS since 2024. She has attended Forward Fellowship Church since 2013. She and her husband, Edgar, have two little blessings Abigail and Max. Mrs. Quiñones holds an MBA from Nova Southeastern University. A verse she holds precious to her is Isaiah 40:31: But they who wait for the Lord shall renew strength; they shall mount up with wings like eagles; they shall run and not be weary; they shall walk and not faint.

Email:quinones.b@colonialchristianschool.org

Tanya Perez

5th Grade Teacher

Mrs. Perez has served at CCS since 2024. She has attended Sunset Church of Christ since 2020. She and her husband, Ronnie Perez, have 2 children: Ryan Jasper and Cody Elliot. Mrs. Perez holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Education Studies and a Bachelor’s Degree in Child Development from the University of Arizona Global Campus. A verse that is precious to her is 2 Corinthians 5:17: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come. This means that anyone who belongs to Christ has become a new person. The old life is gone; a new life has begun!

Email:perez.t@colonialchristianschool.org

Elisa Boatright

2nd Grade Teacher

Mrs. Boatright has served at CCS since 2024. She has attended Christ Journey Church since 2013. She has three children: Alfonso, Eden, and Azariah. Mrs.Boatright holds an AA from Miami Dade College in Speech and Language Pathology and a BS from Florida International University in Exceptional Student Education K-12 . A verse that is precious to her is Jeremiah 29:11: ‘For I know the plans I have for you,’ declares the Lord, “plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.

Email:boatright.e@colonialchristianschool.org

Ginna Rivera

5th Grade Teacher

Mrs. Rivera has served at CCS since March 2024. She has attended Vous Church since 2023 and supports the Essence Worship team as a vocalist and pianist. She and her husband, William, have two daughters, one son, one son-in-law, and a sweet granddaughter. Mrs. Rivera holds a Bachelor’s in Music Production from Full Sail University and a Master’s in Worship Music & Leadership from Liberty University. She has been the school director and teacher at Canzion Institute of Music since 2012 and the author of devotionals from the YouVersion/ Bible App. She loves music, reading, writing, and creating new things. She is passionate about Jesus, leading people to Christ and true worship.

Her favorite Bible verse is: 1 Peter 4:8: And above all things have fervent love for one another, for love will cover a multitude of sins.”

Email:rivera.g@colonialchristianschool.org

Sandra Valenzuela

3rd Grade Teacher

Mrs. Valenzuela has served at CCS since 2006. She has attended EBS Church since 1993. She and her husband, Osiel, have one child, Christopher. Mrs. Valenzuela holds an AA and BS from The University of Phoenix. She is certified with FACCS as an Elementary Teacher. A verse that is precious to her is Isaiah 40:31: But those who wait on the Lord Shall renew their strength: They shall mount up with wings like eagles, They shall run and not be weary, They shall walk and not faint.

Email:valenzuela.s@colonialchristianschool.org

Janelis Camejo

Elementary Interventionalist

Ms. Camejo joined CCS in 2022. She attends Palm Vista Community Church. She has a beloved daughter, Isabella. Ms. Camejo graduated from Miami Dade College with a degree in Business Administration and also holds a BA in Marketing from Florida International University. She is certified with Search and Teach, Florida State, and with FACCS as an elementary teacher and has been teaching for 7 years. A verse that is precious to her is Isaiah 26:4: Trust in the Lord forever, for the Lord, the Lord himself, is the Rock eternal.

Email:camejo.j@colonialchristianschool.org

Secondary Staff

Greg Wells

History and Math Teacher/ Coach

Mr. Wells has served at CCS since 2018. He has attended South Dade Baptist Church since 2020. He and his wife Peggy have three girls: Megan, Madison, and Morgan. Mr. Wells holds a BS from Baptist Bible College and a MS in accounting from Strayer University. He is the Assistant Athletic Director and coaches Boys Basketball as well as Cross Country, and multiple middle school sports. He holds a FACCS certificate in MS Humanities. One of his favorite verses is 1 Kings 2:3: Keep the charge of the LORD your God, walk in His ways, keep His statutes, His commandments, His precepts, and His testimonies.

Email:wells.g@colonialchristianschool.org

Nikol Triana

Social Studies, Digital Media, & Yearbook Teacher

Zanecus Johnson

Bible and Drama Teacher

Lissette Vega

Math Teacher

Mrs. Vega joined CCS in 2022. She attends Life Pointe Church in Homestead, Florida. She and her husband, Rey, have been married since 2006. God has blessed them with 5 adopted children. Mrs. Vega holds a BS in Elementary Education K-6, with an ESOL Endorsement from Barry University and is certified in the state of Florida. She has 17 years of teaching experience combined between private and charter schools. A verse that is precious to her is Proverbs 3:5-6: Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all ways submit to Him, and He will make your paths straight

Randy Diaz

Bible Teacher

Mr. Diaz has served at CCS since 2021. He holds a BA in Christian Ministry from Leavell College of New Orleans Baptist Theological Seminary and is also certified by FACCS. His favorite Scripture is Romans 8:28: And we know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are the called according to His purpose.

Email:diaz.r@colonialchristianschool.org

David Bouwsma

Science Teacher

Molly Mills

English and Math Teacher/ Intervention

Roxane Mclean

STEAM Lab and Science Teacher

Karissa Viggiani

History Teacher

Esther Velez

English Teacher

Ms. Velez has served at CCS since 2017. She has attended Miami Bible Fellowship since 2015. Ms. Velez holds a BA in English from Florida International University. She is certified with FACCS as a Secondary English Teacher. A verse that is precious to her is John 16:33: I have told you these things, so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world.

Email:velez.e@colonialchristianschool.org

Cyndi Viggiani

English Teacher

Cyndi Viggiani joined CCS in 2021. She has attended Pinelands Presbyterian Church since 2006. She and her husband, Norman, have four children: Alexandra, Karissa, Nathan, and Geneva. Mrs. Viggiani holds a BS in English from Liberty University, and an MS from Florida International University. She has over 20 years of teaching experience. A verse that is precious to her is John 1:14: And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we beheld His glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father, full of grace and truth.

Email:viggiani.c@colonialchristianschool.org

Tiffany Easom

Social Studies Teacher/ Academic Advisor

Alex Pecina

Math Teacher

Special Area Teachers

Mabel Yesica Barnett

Art and Spanish Teacher

William Rivera

Music, Math, and Production Teacher

Ashley Eichler

Physical Education

Ms. Eichler joined CCS in 2023. She has attended New Life Sanctuary for many years. She holds an AA in Criminal Justice from Miami-Dade College and a BS in Criminal Justice from Florida International University. A verse that is precious to her is Psalm 93:4: Mightier than the waves of the sea is His love for you.

Email:eichler.a@acolonialchristianschool.org

Teacher’s Aides/Long-term Subs

Darlene Pierre

Science and Computer Teacher/ Teacher's Aide

Mrs. Pierre has served at CCS since 2015. She has attended Summit Church of Homestead since it was established in 2015. She and her husband, Kevin, have two children: Kaelyn and Devin. A verse that is precious to her is Proverbs 3:5-6: Trust in Lord with all your heart, and do not mean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.

Email:pierre.d@colonialchristianschool.org

Natalie Gonzalez-Cammisa

Teacher's Aide

Magaly Teran

Teacher's Aide

Ms Teran joined CCS in 2024.

Mirelis Diaz

Teacher's Aide

Julianne Easom- Alumni

Teacher's Aide/ Long Term Substitute

Anielka Maldonado - Alumni

Teacher's Aide

James Polles

Substitute Teacher

Mr. Polles joined CCS in 2022.

He has attended First Baptist Church of Homestead since 2005 and has been serving as a deacon since 2015. He and his wife, Chrischelle are raising three girls; Chrischelle, Destiny, and Joseelynn. Mr. Polles had served the Coast Guard for 17 years as a volunteer and taught adult boating safety while mastering navigation and search and rescue duties.

Mr. Polles has studied agriculture, horticulture and orchidology with the university of Florida and is a master gardener for Dade county.

A scripture that stands out to him is Ephesians 2:10: For we are His workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand that we should walk in them.

Extended Care Staff

Crystal Nelson

Extended Care Director

Email:nelson.c@colonialchristianschool.org

Office Staff

Jacqui Haponuk

Parent Support Specialist

Mrs. Haponuk has served at CCS since 2016. She has attended South Dade Baptist Church since 2011. She and her husband, Charlie, have three children: Adrianna, Victoria, & Eli. She holds a Business Specialist Certification from MDC. A verse that is precious to her is Isaiah 41:10: Fear not, for I am with you; Be not dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you, Yes, I will help you, I will uphold you with My righteous right hand.

Email:haponuk.j@colonialchristianschool.org

Michelle Zayas

Administrator's Personal Assistant

Mrs. Zayas joined CCS in 2023 when she also began attending South Dade Baptist Church. She and her husband, Anthony, have three wonderful children: Ethan, Michael, and Emma. She has attended Florida International University and has a background in project management. A verse that is precious to her is Jeremiah 29:11: For I know the plans I have for you,” declares the Lord, plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.

Email:zayas.m@colonialchristianschool.org

Julie Paterson

Parental and Business Support Specialist

Mrs. Paterson joined CCS in 2021, when she also began attending South Dade Baptist Church. She and her husband, Ashley, have one daughter, Katrina. Mrs. Paterson graduated from St. Joseph’s Convent College with a BA in Business Administration and Administrative Office Management. A verse that is precious to her is Psalm 106:1: Praise ye the Lord. O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is good; his mercy endureth forever.

Email:paterson.j@colonialchristianschool.org

Johanna Roa

Parent Support Specialist

Rebecca Leon

Marketing & Communication Specialist

Aryeve Espinosa- Alumni

Financial Staff

Jessica Garcell

Finance Manager/Accts. Payable Specialist

Greg Wells

Payroll Specialist

Mr. Wells has served at CCS since 2018. He has attended South Dade Baptist Church since 2020. He and his wife Peggy have three girls: Megan, Madison, and Morgan. Mr. Wells holds a BS from Baptist Bible College and a MS in accounting from Strayer University. He is the Assistant Athletic Director and coaches Boys Basketball as well as Cross Country, and multiple middle school sports. He holds a FACCS certificate in MS Humanities. One of his favorite verses is 1 Kings 2:3: Keep the charge of the LORD your God, walk in His ways, keep His statutes, His commandments, His precepts, and His testimonies.

Email:wells.g@colonialchristianschool.org

Nathan Bush

Accts. Receivable Specialist

Support Staff

Carol Long

Technology Coordinator/ Library Aide

Giovanny Morales

Lawn Care/ Maintenance

Mr. Morales, a graduate from the CCS class of 2023, has been a Patriot since 7th grade. Immediately after graduation, Mr. Morales joined the CCS staff. He is a member of Iglesia Cristo Rey De Reyes. His favorite scripture is Proverbs 3:5-6: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding. In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy path.

Juan Mena

Plant Supervisor

Jeff Kemper

Security

Mr. Kemper joined the CCS staff in 2022.

Email: security@colonialchristianschool.org

Alba Mazariegos

Food Service Manager

Milagros Hernandez

Food Service Worker

Chris Nieto

Lawn Care/ Maintenance

Mr. Nieto has served at CCS since 2022. He attends Pinelands Presbyterian Church. Soon to be married to his beloved Jessica Bouwsma. A verse that he adheres to, comes from Matthew 5:44-45: But I say to you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who spitefully use you and persecute you, that you may be sons of your Father in heaven; for He makes His sun rise on the evil and on the good, and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.

Coaching Staff

Peggy Wells

Athletic Director

Greg Wells

Assistant Athletic Director

Mr. Wells has served at CCS since 2018. He has attended South Dade Baptist Church since 2020. He and his wife Peggy have three girls: Megan, Madison, and Morgan. Mr. Wells holds a BS from Baptist Bible College and a MS in accounting from Strayer University. He is the Assistant Athletic Director and coaches Boys Basketball as well as Cross Country, and multiple middle school sports. He holds a FACCS certificate in MS Humanities. One of his favorite verses is 1 Kings 2:3: Keep the charge of the LORD your God, walk in His ways, keep His statutes, His commandments, His precepts, and His testimonies.

Email:wells.g@colonialchristianschool.org

Coaches

Click here to get to know our Coaches.

Enrichment

Yuliet O'Hallorans

Piano & Voice Instructor

Church Staff

Pastor Bill Long

Senior Pastor

Pastor Bill Long has served at SDBC since 2004. He and his wife, Carol, have 4 grown sons, and 13 grandchildren (8 of whom attend, or have attended CCS). Pastor Long graduated from Manahath School of Theology in 1985 with a BA in Pastoral Ministries, did pulpit supply for area churches in Pennsylvania, and worked as a Christian counselor at the Altoona Christian Counseling Center. A verse that is precious to him is 2 Chronicles 16:9: For the eyes of the Lord run to and fro throughout the whole earth to show Himself strong on behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward Him.

Email:long.pastorbill@colonialchristianschool.org

Lupe Haskins

Church Secretary

Mrs. Haskins has served as the Senior Pastor’s Secretary at South Dade Baptist Church since February 2019. She has attended South Dade Baptist Church since 2015, and married long-time SDBC church member, Chris Haskins, in 2016. Mrs. Haskins holds 30 years of customer service experience. She has two children: Nicholas and Joshua. A verse that is precious to her is Proverbs 3:5-6: Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and lean not on your own understanding; In all your ways acknowledge Him, and He shall direct your paths.

Email:haskins.l@colonialchristianschool.org

Summer Staff

John Morrissey Sr.

Summer Camp Director
